intro: Erycibe crassipes f. crassipes, commonly known as the thick-leaved erycibe, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
